gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - delta_13C from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: delta 13C measurement of dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) from GT10 and GT11 cruises. Dataset Description: <p>delta 13C measurements made on dissolved inorganic carbon (DIC) samples collected at stations during the GT10 and GT11 (KN199-04 and KN204-01) cruises as part of the U.S. GEOTRACES North Atlantic Transect project.</p><p>Version History:<br />17 June 2014&nbsp;(current version) = data updated/corrections made; several bottle numbers, cast numbers, and depth values that were previously erroneous have been corrected;<br />04 April 2013 = original data submitted.</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Shipboard Sample Collection Methods</strong><br />Samples are collected in pre-washed and baked 250 ml ground glass stoppered bottles that were poisoned with 100Âµl of a saturated HgCl2 solution. The stored sealed samples were returned to the Stable Isotope Laboratory at the University of Washington for extraction and measurement.</p><p><strong>Laboratory Methods</strong><br />CO2 is extracted from the DIC seawater sample using a modification of the helium stripping technique described in Quay et al (1992). The del13C is measured on a Thermo Delta Plus XL mass spectrometer.</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br />Quay, P.D., B. Tilbrook and C.S. Wong. 1992. Oceanic uptake of fossil fuel CO2: carbon-13 evidence, Science 256: 74-79. DOI: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1126/science.256.5053.74" target="_blank">10.1126/science.256.5053.74</a></p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0926213 Award URL: http://nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=0926213
Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1137455 Award URL: http://nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1137455

Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33572.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: dimensionless Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33573.rdf Name: cruise_name Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES cruise identifier. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33574.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33575.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33576.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Cast', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33577.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; rangies from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Sample', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33578.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude ranging from 0 to +/- 180. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33579.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude ranging from 0 to +/- 180. Negative values = West. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33580.rdf Name: month Units: mm (01 to 12) Description: 2-digit month of year (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33581.rdf Name: day Units: dd (01 to 31) Description: 2-digit day of month (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33582.rdf Name: year Units: YYYY Description: 4-digit year (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33583.rdf Name: delta13C Units: per mil Description: A measure of the ratio of stable isotopes 13C:12C, reported in parts per thousand (per mil, o/oo) reported vs PDB. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33584.rdf Name: delta13C_flag Units: dimensionless Description: Quality flag for delta13C.2 = good data3 = questionable data9 = no data http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33585.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33586.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33587.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33589.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33590.rdf Name: lat_nom Units: decimal degrees Description: Nominal latitude of station. BCO-DMO added from station waypoints provided by Chief Sci. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33591.rdf Name: lon_nom Units: decimal degrees Description: Nominal longitude of station. BCO-DMO added from station waypoints provided by Chief Sci.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/YEARXXXX/ Name: Year since birth of Christ Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/D13CMITX/ Name: Enrichment of 13C in inorganic carbon in the water body [dissolved plus reactive particulate phase] by acidification and mass spectrometry Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES cruise identifier.; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Cast', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; rangies from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Sample', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Latitude ranging from 0 to +/- 180.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude ranging from 0 to +/- 180. Negative values = West.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: 2-digit month of year (UTC).; General Description: month of year, utc time, Use month_gmt for future data sets.
PI-supplied Description: 2-digit day of month (UTC).; General Description: day, GMT time e.g. 22.

PI-supplied Description: 4-digit year (UTC).; General Description: year, reported as YYYY, e.g. 1995 NERC Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: A measure of the ratio of stable isotopes 13C:12C, reported in parts per thousand (per mil, o/oo) reported vs PDB.; General Description: Carbon 13 to Carbon 12 ratio of TCO2; CAUTION file dependent definition changes slightly between EqPac and Southern basin studies NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for delta13C.2 = good data3 = questionable data9 = no data; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: rosette bottle number

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'
PI-supplied Description: Nominal latitude of station. BCO-DMO added from station waypoints provided by Chief Sci.; General Description: nominal latitude; negative denotes South
PI-supplied Description: Nominal longitude of station. BCO-DMO added from station waypoints provided by Chief Sci.; General Description: nominal longitude; negative denotes West

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Shipboard Sample Collection Methods</strong><br />Samples are collected in pre-washed and baked 250 ml ground glass stoppered bottles that were poisoned with 100Âµl of a saturated HgCl2 solution. The stored sealed samples were returned to the Stable Isotope Laboratory at the University of Washington for extraction and measurement.</p><p><strong>Laboratory Methods</strong><br />CO2 is extracted from the DIC seawater sample using a modification of the helium stripping technique described in Quay et al (1992). The del13C is measured on a Thermo Delta Plus XL mass spectrometer.</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br />Quay, P.D., B. Tilbrook and C.S. Wong. 1992. Oceanic uptake of fossil fuel CO2: carbon-13 evidence, Science 256: 74-79. DOI: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1126/science.256.5053.74" target="_blank">10.1126/science.256.5053.74</a></p>

<p><strong>Data Processing</strong><br />Surface samples collected at stations through sample clean seawater feed have no cast and sample numbers.<br />Quality flags here include:<br />2 = good data;<br />3 = questionable data;<br />9 = no data.</p><p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing Notes</strong>:<br />- Modified parameter names to conform with BCO-DMO naming conventions.<br />- Separated original date field into month, day, and year.<br />- Replaced blanks with 'nd'.<br />- Added 'cruise_id' based on the 'cruise_name' provided.<br />- lat_nom and lon_nom were added from station waypoints provided by the cruise Chief Scientists.</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:The del13C is measured on a Thermo Delta Plus XL mass spectrometer. Instrument Name: Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:IR Mass Spec Instrument Description: The Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer is a particular type of mass spectrometer used to measure the relative abundance of isotopes in a given sample (e.g. VG Prism II Isotope Ratio Mass-Spectrometer). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB16/
